description: a(n) is the smallest prime such that the number of primes produced according to rules stipulated in Honaker's A048853 is n.
formula: A048853(a(n))=n. a(n) is prime. a(n)>=A050662(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 25 2006
maple: A048853 := proc(n::integer) local resul,ddigs,d,c,tmp,tst ; resul := 0 ; ddigs := convert(n,base,10) ; for d from 1 to nops(ddigs) do for c from 0 to 9 do if c = 0 and d = nops(ddigs) then continue ; else if c <> op(d,ddigs) then tmp := [op(1..d-1,ddigs),c,op(d+1..nops(ddigs),ddigs)] ; tst := sum(op(i,tmp)*10^(i-1),i=1..nops(tmp)) ; if isprime(tst) then resul := resul+1 ; fi ; fi ; fi ; od : od ; RETURN(resul) ; end: A050673 := proc(n::integer) local i,p; for p from 1 to 10000000 do i := ithprime(p) ; if A048853(i) = n then RETURN(i) ; fi ; od ; RETURN(-1) ; end : for n from 1 to 90 do print(A050673(n)) ; od ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 25 2006
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Jul 15 1999
extensions: a(26) and a(28) from _Giovanni Resta_, Aug 14 2013
